cards.name: Vilefin Inquisitor
cards.flavor: Nobody expects the Vilefin Inquisition!
cards.text: Battlecry: Your Hero Power becomes 'Summon a   1/1 Murloc.'

cards.name: Primal Fusion
cards.flavor: Golce and Dabbana have a new line of Earth Totems available at vendors everywhere this holiday season.
cards.text: Give a minion +1/+1 for each of your Totems.

cards.name: Flamewreathed Faceless
cards.flavor: He's on fire! Boomshakalaka!
cards.text: Overload: (2)

cards.name: Eternal Sentinel
cards.flavor: Just try to avoid eye contact.
cards.text: Battlecry: Unlock your Overloaded Mana Crystals.

cards.name: Evolve
cards.flavor: So you say you want an evolution. Well, you know. We all want to change the board.
cards.text: Transform your minions into random minions that cost (1) more.

cards.name: Thing from Below
cards.flavor: Just can't resist the opportunity to hang around with a bunch of totems.
cards.text: Taunt Costs (1) less for each Totem you've summoned this game.

cards.name: Hammer of Twilight
cards.flavor: Stop! It's Twilight Hammer time.
cards.text: Deathrattle: Summon a 4/2 Elemental.

cards.name: Tentacles for Arms
cards.flavor: That's right. Garrosh just slapped you to death with a tentacle.
cards.text: Deathrattle: Return this to your hand.

cards.name: Silithid Swarmer
cards.flavor: If your hero doesn't attack, it's just 'Silithid Loner'.
cards.text: Can only attack if your hero attacked this turn.

cards.name: Y'Shaarj, Rage Unbound
cards.flavor: When he's working out, he binds all that rage back into a ponytail.
cards.text: At the end of your turn, put a minion from your deck into the battlefield.

cards.name: Fandral Staghelm
cards.flavor: Always manages to mention 'Back when I was creating the World Tree…' in EVERY conversation. Sheesh! Enough already.
cards.text: Your Choose One cards and powers have both effects combined.

cards.name: Infest
cards.flavor: The best part is the look on their face when you jump out of the cake! Err… corpse.
cards.text: Give your minions 'Deathrattle: Add a random Beast to your hand.'

cards.name: Feral Rage
cards.flavor: Let's be honest. One option is a lot ragier than the other.
cards.text: Choose One - Give your hero +4 Attack this turn; or Gain 8 Armor.

cards.name: Mark of Y'Shaarj
cards.flavor: Y'Shaarj had three sons: Mark, Theodore, and Chris.
cards.text: Give a minion +2/+2. If it's a Beast, draw a card.

cards.name: Forbidden Ancient
cards.flavor: This Ancient was banned from the local tavern after tucking a 'Dr. Boom' up its sleeve.
cards.text: Battlecry: Spend all your Mana. Gain +1/+1 for each mana spent.

cards.name: On the Hunt
cards.flavor: The mastiff giggles if you don't hit any ducks.
cards.text: Deal $1 damage. Summon a 1/1 Mastiff.

cards.name: Bladed Cultist
cards.flavor: He has a poor understanding of the law of diminishing returns.
cards.text: Combo: Gain +1/+1.

cards.name: Journey Below
cards.flavor: Don't stop believing there's something below.
cards.text: Discover a Deathrattle card.

cards.name: Thistle Tea
cards.flavor: Aren't Thistles prickly?  Why would you drink them? I don't get Rogues.
cards.text: Draw a card. Add 2 extra copies of it to your hand.

cards.name: Xaril, Poisoned Mind
cards.flavor: It's basically your own fault if you go around drinking weird green potions handed out by creepy mantid dudes.
cards.text: Battlecry and Deathrattle: Add a random Toxin card to your hand.

cards.name: Shatter
cards.flavor: What's cooler than being cool?
cards.text: Destroy a Frozen minion.

cards.name: Evolved Kobold
cards.flavor: You no take tentacle!
cards.text: Spell Damage +2

cards.name: Twilight Flamecaller
cards.flavor: Make sure you summon a Twilight Marshmallowcaller too! Mmmm Mmm Mmm!!
cards.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to all enemy minions.

cards.name: Demented Frostcaller
cards.flavor: He prefers that you refer to him by his nickname: 'Frostwaker.'
cards.text: After you cast a spell, Freeze a random enemy.

cards.name: Forbidden Flame
cards.flavor: WARNING: This flame is not to be used unless you are a licensed acolyte of the Old Gods.
cards.text: Spend all your Mana. Deal that much damage to a minion.

cards.name: Servant of Yogg-Saron
cards.flavor: Yogg-Saron always likes to complain about how he has too many servants and there are too many mouths to feed.
cards.text: Battlecry: Cast a random spell that costs (5) or less (targets chosen randomly).

cards.name: Cabalist's Tome
cards.flavor: What's in there? I bet it's cookie recipes!
cards.text: Add 3 random Mage spells to your hand.

cards.name: Power Word: Tentacles
cards.flavor: Because you're wrapped in a protective layer of… tentacles?
cards.text: Give a minion +2/+6.

cards.name: Twilight Darkmender
cards.flavor: First she separates them from the lights, washes them in cold water, and hang-dries.
cards.text: Battlecry: If your C'Thun  has at least 10 Attack, restore 10 Health to your hero.

cards.name: Shadow Word: Horror
cards.flavor: It's more succinct than 'Shadow Word: Suck Into Vortex.'
cards.text: Destroy all minions with 2 or less Attack.

cards.name: Forbidden Shaping
cards.flavor: But the minion arrives covered in goo.
cards.text: Spend all your Mana. Summon a random minion that costs that much.

cards.name: Darkspeaker
cards.flavor: People often think that Darkspeaker is the arch nemesis of Lightspeaker, but that title actually belongs to Heavyspeaker.
cards.text: Battlecry: Swap stats with a friendly minion.

cards.name: Embrace the Shadow
cards.flavor: For when your Auchenai Soulpriests call in sick.
cards.text: This turn, your healing effects deal damage instead.

cards.name: Darkshire Librarian
cards.flavor: Do NOT be late with your overdue fines.
cards.text: Battlecry: Discard a random card. Deathrattle: Draw a card.

cards.name: Darkshire Councilman
cards.flavor: Democracy in action!
cards.text: After you summon a minion,  gain +1 Attack.

cards.name: Forbidden Ritual
cards.flavor: Actually, C'Thun gives his full support for this ritual.
cards.text: Spend all your Mana. Summon that many 1/1 Tentacles.

cards.name: Spreading Madness
cards.flavor: Most citizens of Darkshire wear those surgical masks to prevent spreading Madness to tourists.
cards.text: Deal $9 damage randomly split among ALL characters.

cards.name: Renounce Darkness
cards.flavor: SEE YA DARKNESS!
cards.text: Replace your Hero Power and Warlock cards with another class's. The cards cost (1) less.

cards.name: Anomalus
cards.flavor: That's short for 'Anomnomnomnomalus'.
cards.text: Deathrattle: Deal 8 damage to all minions.

cards.name: Cho'gall
cards.flavor: Even after all this time, Gul'dan still makes Cho'gall go get donuts and coffee.
cards.text: Battlecry: The next spell you cast this turn costs Health instead of Mana.

cards.name: Mukla, Tyrant of the Vale
cards.flavor: Pro tip: DO NOT BOGART THE BANANAS.
cards.text: Battlecry: Add 2 Bananas to your hand.

cards.name: Shifter Zerus
cards.flavor: It's like being able to play with THREE angry chickens!
cards.text: Each turn this is in your hand, transform it into a random minion.

cards.name: Twin Emperor Vek'lor
cards.flavor: Do they make decisions based on age? 'I'm two minutes older therefore we burn this village.'
cards.text: Taunt Battlecry: If your C'Thun has at least 10 Attack, summon another Emperor.

cards.name: N'Zoth, the Corruptor
cards.flavor: Has not been able to get 'Under the Sea' out of his head for like FIVE THOUSAND YEARS.
cards.text: Battlecry: Summon your Deathrattle minions that died this game.

cards.name: Yogg-Saron, Hope's End
cards.flavor: I spell your doom... Y-O-U-R D-O-O-M!
cards.text: Battlecry: Cast a random spell for each spell you've cast this game (targets chosen randomly).

cards.name: Nerubian Prophet
cards.flavor: It’s a self-reducing prophecy.
cards.text: At the start of your turn, reduce this card's Cost by (1).

cards.name: Faceless Behemoth
cards.flavor: Rejected names: Forty-Foot Faceless, Big ol' No-face, Huge Creature Sans Face, Teddy.

cards.name: Eldritch Horror
cards.flavor: Often wonders what path his life might have taken if he wasn't named, you know, 'Eldritch Horror'.

cards.name: Psych-o-Tron
cards.flavor: 'Annoyinger-o-Tron' was just too unwieldy. And accurate.
cards.text: Taunt Divine Shield

cards.name: Corrupted Healbot
cards.flavor: Not so much 'corrupted' as 'has terrible aim'.
cards.text: Deathrattle: Restore 8 Health to the enemy hero.

cards.name: Ravaging Ghoul
cards.flavor: But goes by 'Ravishing Ghoul' when he hits the club.
cards.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to all other minions.

cards.name: Aberrant Berserker
cards.flavor: I berserk, therefore I am.
cards.text: Enrage: +2 Attack.

cards.name: Tentacle of N'Zoth
cards.flavor: Because EVERYDAY is the Day of the Tentacle of N'zoth.
cards.text: Deathrattle: Deal 1 damage to all minions.

cards.name: Grotesque Dragonhawk
cards.flavor: They say that 'grotesque is in the eye of the beholder,' but that's just because they've never seen a Grotesque Dragonhawk. Yikes!
cards.text: Windfury

cards.name: Bog Creeper
cards.flavor: He's tried other things, but bog sidling, bog ambling, and bog trundling just aren't as effective as bog creeping.
cards.text: Taunt

cards.name: Bilefin Tidehunter
cards.flavor: Bile actually makes for surprisingly sturdy fins.
cards.text: Battlecry: Summon a 1/1 Ooze with Taunt.

cards.name: Zealous Initiate
cards.flavor: Ok, Initiate. You need to settle down and do your job. In this case, that means die so someone else can get a minor buff.
cards.text: Deathrattle: Give a random friendly minion +1/+1.

cards.name: Corrupted Seer
cards.flavor: For seers, it's very handy to have your crystal ball hanging right in front of your face.
cards.text: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage to all non-Murloc minions.

cards.name: Disciple of C'Thun
cards.flavor: C’Thun’s recruiting pitch involves cookies, which is why it’s the most popular Old God.
cards.text: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage. Give your C'Thun +2/+2 (wherever it is).

cards.name: Blood of The Ancient One
cards.flavor: Add two cups of Blood of the Ancient One to one cup of lemon juice. Add just a dash of sugar and stir. Delicious!
cards.text: If you control two of these at the end of your turn, merge them into 'The Ancient One'.

cards.name: Faceless Shambler
cards.flavor: 'What is that thing?!' 'I'm not sure, but it seems to be sort of Ysera shaped.'
cards.text: Taunt Battlecry: Copy a friendly minion's Attack and Health.

cards.name: Shadow Strike
cards.flavor: It's like a backstab, only from the front. And with two more stabs.
cards.text: Deal $5 damage to an undamaged character.

cards.name: Fiery Bat
cards.flavor: He'll always be our first.
cards.text: Deathrattle: Deal 1 damage to a random enemy.

cards.name: Klaxxi Amber-Weaver
cards.flavor: Amberweaving is a specialty course at the local trade school.
cards.text: Battlecry: If your C'Thun has at least 10 Attack, gain +5 Health.

cards.name: Wisps of the Old Gods
cards.flavor: They're just normal wisps, actually. The 'Of the Old Gods' bit is just marketing.
cards.text: Choose One - Summon seven 1/1 Wisps; or Give your minions +2/+2.

cards.name: Forbidden Healing
cards.flavor: No one's quite sure why it's forbidden. And yes, that should make you nervous.
cards.text: Spend all your Mana. Restore twice that much Health.

cards.name: Validated Doomsayer
cards.flavor: Really feels good about himself and is in a much better place now. But… he sure does miss piloting those shredders.
cards.text: At the start of your turn, set this minion's Attack to 7.

cards.name: Mire Keeper
cards.flavor: 'Hey.... Is that Mire for sale?'  'No.  I'm keeping it.'
cards.text: Choose One - Summon a 2/2 Slime; or Gain an empty Mana Crystal.

cards.name: Stormcrack
cards.flavor: WARNING: DO NOT TOUCH THE PURPLE BALL OF LIGHTNING
cards.text: Deal $4 damage to a minion. Overload: (1)

cards.name: Faceless Summoner
cards.flavor: They never get the recognition they deserve.
cards.text: Battlecry: Summon a random 3-Cost minion.

cards.name: Hallazeal the Ascended
cards.flavor: Hallazeals all your dallazamage.
cards.text: Whenever your spells deal damage, restore that much Health to your hero.

cards.name: Call of the Wild
cards.flavor: 'Hello. Misha, Leokk and Huffer aren't here right now, but if you leave a message we'll get back to you right away.' BEEP.
cards.text: Summon all three Animal Companions.

cards.name: Infested Wolf
cards.flavor: A little flea powder will fix that right up.
cards.text: Deathrattle: Summon two 1/1 Spiders.

cards.name: Bloodhoof Brave
cards.flavor: He thought the set was called 'Flippers of the Old Cods' and hungrily volunteered to be in it.  He is definitely going to get his hearing checked.
cards.text: Taunt Enrage: +3 Attack.

cards.name: Malkorok
cards.flavor: Garrosh's best buddy. It's true. Look it up.
cards.text: Battlecry: Equip a random weapon.

cards.name: Selfless Hero
cards.flavor: 'Don't worry about me… I'll just be here... under these tentacles.'
cards.text: Deathrattle: Give a random friendly minion Divine Shield.

cards.name: Rallying Blade
cards.flavor: As far as blades go, this one is pretty great in the motivation department.
cards.text: Battlecry: Give +1/+1 to your minions with Divine Shield.

cards.name: Divine Strength
cards.flavor: Every year a few paladins get disqualified from the Westfall weight lifting championship for using Divine Strength.
cards.text: Give a minion +1/+2.

cards.name: Ragnaros, Lightlord
cards.flavor: What happens when you try and corrupt a corrupted firelord? DOUBLE NEGATIVE, INSECT!
cards.text: At the end of your turn, restore 8 Health to a damaged friendly character.

cards.name: Darkshire Alchemist
cards.flavor: The secret ingredient: liquified funnel cake.
cards.text: Battlecry: Restore 5 Health.

cards.name: DOOM!
cards.flavor: We ran out of space for 'DOOOOOOOOOOOM!!!!!'
cards.text: Destroy all minions. Draw a card for each.

cards.name: Possessed Villager
cards.flavor: It's like a pinata! A lame disgusting horrific pinata.
cards.text: Deathrattle: Summon a 1/1 Shadowbeast.

cards.name: Twisted Worgen
cards.flavor: Sometimes the Old Gods' corruptions gives you power untold, sometimes you get +1 Attack. We can’t all be winners in the Eldritch lottery.
cards.text: Stealth

cards.name: Am'gam Rager
cards.flavor: peerc rewop

cards.name: Infested Tauren
cards.flavor: The Overmind and the Old Gods are surprisingly similar.
cards.text: Taunt Deathrattle: Summon a 2/2 Slime.

cards.name: Eater of Secrets
cards.flavor: You don't want to be around after it has eaten an explosive trap.  You thought Sludge Belcher was bad...
cards.text: Battlecry: Destroy all enemy Secrets. Gain +1/+1 for each.

cards.name: Doomcaller
cards.flavor: 'Hello, is Doom there? No? Can I leave a message?'
cards.text: Battlecry: Give your C'Thun +2/+2 (wherever it is). If it's dead, shuffle it into your deck.

cards.name: Spawn of N'Zoth
cards.flavor: Who's a cute widdle N'Zoth? You are! Yes you are! Yes you're the cutest widdle N'Zoth in the whole world!!!
cards.text: Deathrattle: Give your minions +1/+1.

cards.name: Southsea Squidface
cards.flavor: Quick! Before I drown! Let me sharpen your sword for you.
cards.text: Deathrattle: Give your weapon +2 Attack.

cards.name: Scaled Nightmare
cards.flavor: I like it because it scales.
cards.text: At the start of your turn, double this minion's Attack.

cards.name: Twilight Summoner
cards.flavor: If you strike him down, he shall become more powerful than you can possibly imagine.
cards.text: Deathrattle: Summon a 5/5 Faceless Destroyer.

cards.name: Stand Against Darkness
cards.flavor: Or if you're too tired, you can just kind of lean against the darkness.
cards.text: Summon five 1/1 Silver Hand Recruits.

cards.name: Blood Warriors
cards.flavor: They have an uneasy rivalry with the Blood Paladins.
cards.text: Add a copy of each damaged friendly minion to your hand.

cards.name: C'Thun
cards.flavor: C'Thun's least favorite Hearthstone card: Eye for an Eye.
cards.howToEarn: Unlocked when opening a Whispers of the Old Gods pack.
cards.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked after opening a Whispers of the Old Gods pack.
cards.text: Battlecry: Deal damage equal to this minion's Attack randomly split among all enemies.

cards.name: Beckoner of Evil
cards.flavor: Here, Evil!  C'mon boy!
cards.howToEarn: Unlocked when opening a Whispers of the Old Gods pack.
cards.howToEarnGolden: Crafting unlocked after opening a Whispers of the Old Gods pack.
cards.text: Battlecry: Give your C'Thun +2/+2 (wherever it is).

cards.name: Blade of C'Thun
cards.flavor: C'Thun demands a sacrifice! Preferably a Deathwing.
cards.text: Battlecry: Destroy a minion. Add its Attack and Health to your C'Thun's (wherever it is).

cards.name: C'Thun's Chosen
cards.flavor: He gave her a promise ring and everything.
cards.text: Divine Shield Battlecry: Give your C'Thun +2/+2 (wherever it is).

cards.name: Twilight Geomancer
cards.flavor: 'Ok C'Thun, repeat after me: 'Your mother was a hamster.''
cards.text: Taunt Battlecry: Give your C'Thun Taunt (wherever it is).

cards.name: Twilight Elder
cards.flavor: Just doesn't understand those Twilight Youngsters any more - with their comic books and their rock music.
cards.text: At the end of your turn, give your C'Thun +1/+1 (wherever it is).

cards.name: Ancient Harbinger
cards.flavor: 'honey, can u run down to the store and pick up some 10 cost minions? thx'
cards.text: At the start of your turn, put a 10-Cost minion from your deck into your hand.

cards.name: Shadowcaster
cards.flavor: I mean, it's not creepy if you ASK before you steal their shadow to make a small replica of them to keep on your shelf.
cards.text: Battlecry: Choose a friendly minion. Add a 1/1 copy to your hand that costs (1).

cards.name: Forlorn Stalker
cards.flavor: He's going to leave the dying up to you, if that's cool.
cards.text: Battlecry: Give all Deathrattle minions in your hand +1/+1.

cards.name: Dark Arakkoa
cards.flavor: There's a whole gradient of Arakkoa! This one is on the darker side.
cards.text: Taunt Battlecry: Give your C'Thun +3/+3 (wherever it is).

cards.name: Cult Apothecary
cards.flavor: Cults need pharmacists too.
cards.text: Battlecry: For each enemy minion, restore 2 Health to your hero.

cards.name: The Boogeymonster
cards.flavor: Has 20 years of training in classical ballet, but ALLLLLL he ever gets asked to do is boogie.
cards.text: Whenever this attacks and kills a minion, gain +2/+2.

cards.name: Ancient Shieldbearer
cards.flavor: Back in her day, each shield weighed two tons and she had to carry four of them on each arm!
cards.text: Battlecry: If your C'Thun has at least 10 Attack, gain 10 Armor.

cards.name: Usher of Souls
cards.flavor: Nothing unburdens your soul like a good ushing!
cards.text: Whenever a friendly minion dies, give your C'Thun +1/+1 (wherever it is).

cards.name: Cult Sorcerer
cards.flavor: No matter how many times we tell her not to, she keeps feeding C'Thun scraps under the table.
cards.text: Spell Damage +1 After you cast a spell, give your C'Thun +1/+1 (wherever it is).

cards.name: Giant Sand Worm
cards.flavor: Banned from every all-you-can-eat buffet on Azeroth.
cards.text: Whenever this attacks and kills a minion, it may attack again.

cards.name: Princess Huhuran
cards.flavor: She flitters around Ahn'Qiraj dreaming of the day she will meet a sweet prince, whom she can lay thousands of eggs with.
cards.text: Battlecry: Trigger a friendly minion's Deathrattle.

cards.name: Steward of Darkshire
cards.flavor: Turns out divine shields are way cheaper if you buy in bulk.
cards.text: Whenever you summon a 1-Health minion, give it Divine Shield.

cards.name: A Light in the Darkness
cards.flavor: Wait, how can you have a light in the dark?  If you turn on a light while it’s dark, doesn’t that mean it’s no longer dark?
cards.text: Discover a minion. Give it +1/+1.

cards.name: N'Zoth's First Mate
cards.flavor: Hates when N'Zoth yells 'Ahoy Matey!!', but there's not really much he can do about it.
cards.text: Battlecry: Equip a 1/3 Rusty Hook.

cards.name: Addled Grizzly
cards.flavor: Druids who spend too long in bear form are more susceptible to the whispers of the Old Gods.  Right now they are whispering the lyrics to 'La Bamba'.
cards.text: After you summon a minion, give it +1/+1.

cards.name: Blood To Ichor
cards.flavor: For his next trick, he turns the ichor back to blood and stuffs it back in you.
cards.text: Deal $1 damage to a minion. If it survives, summon a 2/2 Slime.

cards.name: Bloodsail Cultist
cards.flavor: They're really just in it for the Blood Parrot.
cards.text: Battlecry: If you control another Pirate, give your weapon +1/+1.

cards.name: Herald Volazj
cards.flavor: His whole job is yelling 'Yogg-Saron comin'!'
cards.text: Battlecry: Summon a 1/1 copy of each of your other minions.

cards.name: Deathwing, Dragonlord
cards.flavor: To his credit, Deathwing really took to heart the feedback he was receiving that he needed to be 'more of a team player'.
cards.text: Deathrattle: Put all Dragons from your hand into the battlefield.

cards.name: Hogger, Doom of Elwynn
cards.flavor: When C'thun went to sleep, he checked under his bed for Hogger.
cards.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, summon a 2/2 Gnoll with Taunt.

cards.name: Midnight Drake
cards.flavor: Still fearsome in the daytime.
cards.text: Battlecry: Gain +1 Attack for each other card in your hand.

cards.name: Crazed Worshipper
cards.flavor: Every month they share a pancake breakfast with the Perfectly Rational Worshippers.
cards.text: Taunt. Whenever this minion takes damage, give your C'Thun +1/+1 (wherever it is).

cards.name: Blackwater Pirate
cards.flavor: 'Look, they fell off the back of a ship, do you want them or not? I have a meeting with Y'Shaarj in like ten minutes.'
cards.text: Your weapons cost (2) less.

cards.name: Polluted Hoarder
cards.flavor: Roll ‘greed’ OR THIS COULD HAPPEN TO YOU.
cards.text: Deathrattle: Draw a card.

cards.name: Carrion Grub
cards.flavor: Carrion, my wayward grub.

cards.name: Duskboar
cards.flavor: Often excluded from dinner parties.  To be fair, he is very boaring.

cards.name: Squirming Tentacle
cards.flavor: Yeah, I think we can agree that killing the squirming tentacle first is a good idea.
cards.text: Taunt

cards.name: Master of Evolution
cards.flavor: Will be really useful in the new 'Hearthémon' game.
cards.text: Battlecry: Transform a friendly minion into a random one that costs (1) more.

cards.name: Undercity Huckster
cards.flavor: Psst! Wanna buy a random class card (from your opponent's class)?
cards.text: Deathrattle: Add a random class card to your hand (from your opponent's class).

cards.name: Hooded Acolyte
cards.flavor: Wait, what kind of acolyte doesn't wear a hood?
cards.text: Whenever a character is healed, give your C'Thun +1/+1 (wherever it is).

cards.name: Shifting Shade
cards.flavor: Yeah, it's cooler in the shade, but you're also more likely to get JACKED.
cards.text: Deathrattle: Copy a card from your opponent's deck  and add it to your hand.

cards.name: Cyclopian Horror
cards.flavor: What are the qualifications for being a 'Horror?'  Just how horrible do you have to be?
cards.text: Taunt. Battlecry: Gain      +1 Health for each enemy minion.

cards.name: Nat, the Darkfisher
cards.flavor: You can take away his humanity, but you will never take away his fishing pole.
cards.text: At the start of your opponent's turn, they have a 50% chance to draw an extra card.

cards.name: Skeram Cultist
cards.flavor: Just before he comes into play, there is an AWESOME training montage with C'Thun.
cards.text: Battlecry: Give your C'Thun +2/+2 (wherever it is).

cards.name: Soggoth the Slitherer
cards.flavor: Don't tell Soggoth, but in the future he gets totally owned by the Master's Glaive and his skull becomes a tourist attraction.
cards.text: Taunt Can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.
